sentence: One important metric to look for in a stock is an 80 or higher Relative Strength Rating .
Ebix ( EBIX ) just hit that mark, with a jump from 77 to 86 Thursday.
[ibd-display-video id=2102289 width=50 float=left autostart=true] This exclusive rating from Investor's Business Daily tracks market leadership with a 1 (worst) to 99 (best) score.
The score shows how a stock's price performance over the last 52 weeks compares to all the other stocks in our database.
History reveals that the stocks that go on to make the biggest gains tend to have an RS Rating of above 80 as they begin their biggest price moves.

Ebix is now considered extended and out of buy range after clearing a 65.20 buy point in a first-stage consolidation .
